Description: Six joining fragments (including 1888,0601.395c) of rim and floor of a large North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; low, rounded ring foot; offset on floor near join with foot; curving rim. On rim, maeander frieze between bands; on floor part of animal frieze sporadically preserved: two ducks to left, head of further creature. Underside of rim glazed with one reserved band; foot glazed; underside of floor reserved. Two pre-firing suspension holes on rim with a third drilled post-firing beside them (not obviously a repair hole).
Curator's comments: From same vessel as 1888,0601.395a*& c*. 1924,0222.222 and 1965,09309.708 may be from the same plate.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.242, no.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1087)
